text: Pierre Cathala (1888 - 1947) was a French politician. He served as the French Minister of Finance from 1942 to 1944. ==Early life== Pierre Cathala was born on 22 September 1888 in Montfort-sur-Meu, Brittany, France. He was educated at the Lycée Saint-Louis, and in Bayonne where he became friends with Pierre Laval. ==Career== Cathala served as the French Minister of Finance from 1942 to 1944. ==Personal life== Cathala married Mathilde Henriette Lagrange. They had two sons, François and Jean-Claude, and a daughter, Renée. ==Death== Cathala died on 27 July 1947 in Paris, France. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1888 births Category:1947 deaths Category:People from Ille- et-Vilaine Category:Politicians from Brittany Category:Radical Party (France) politicians Category:Social and Radical Left politicians Category:Independent Radical politicians Category:French Ministers of Finance Category:Government ministers of France Category:Members of the 14th Chamber of Deputies of the French Third Republic Category:Members of the 15th Chamber of Deputies of the French Third Republic Category:People of Vichy France Category:French military personnel of World War I Category:Recipients of the Croix de Guerre 1914–1918 (France)
title: Pierre Cathala
